titleStmt.title: Despatch from Robert S. Newton to John Davis, January 15 1885

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

bibl.title: Despatch from Robert S. Newton to John Davis
Despatches from United States Consuls in St Paul Loanda

div1.p: I have the honor to inform the Department that I have today taken passage for the sailor, Albert Svenson to St Thiago per ss "Portugal."

This man is a deserter from the Bark "Horace Scudder" having stolen a boat and gone on shore at Novo Redondo, he was handed over to me by the Portuguese Government having been brought to Loanda, by the Gun vessel "Vilhena" together with another man also a deserter. I put them in prison, but this man falling ill had to go to the hospital and was unable to leave in the ship
For his passage I have passed a draft on the Secretary of State @ 15 d/s in favor of Snr Ernst George, Agent at Lisbon of the Steamers for $36 94/100.

I have the honor to be Sir
Your obedient Servant
Robt S. Newton
Vice Consul
div1.fw:
To the
Assistant Secretary of State
Washington DC
